results.title: Adventures in the Strait
results.creator_credit: Sorogo Mills, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The rope that linked the dinghy to the boat had snapped. It was up to me to fix it. Sorogo’s story about an experience that showed him what he was really made of.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sorogo Mills, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Nana fish
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Mullie Watson and ACMI
results.brief_description: Originally from Cherbourg, Mullie Watson tells of his fond memories of his nan, about the day they went fishing together and how an owl became his totem.

results.title: This is a story about the land we live on
results.creator_credit: Alisha Dark, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: This land has cared for our ancestors for generations and now it’s our turn to care for it. We need to take responsibility. This story is about Alisha’s personal connection with the land.

results.title: ACMI Animation Open Studios: three weekends in September and October 2007
results.creator_credit: Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Three animators - Dave Jones, Nick Hilligoss, Steve Piscopo - participated in three weekends over September and October 2007 in the ACMI Animation Open Studios (as part of Pixar) sharing their secrets with people of all ages. Using a combination of moving image, stills and animation to a music soundtrack, this is a record of what took place.
results.title_for_label: ACMI Animation Open Studios: three weekends in September and October 2007
results.description: Three animators - Dave Jones, Nick Hilligoss, Steve Piscopo - participated in three weekends over September and October 2007 in the ACMI Animation Open Studios (as part of Pixar) sharing their secrets with people of all ages. Using a combination of moving image, stills and animation to a music soundtrack, this is a record of what took place.
description_for_label: Three animators - Dave Jones, Nick Hilligoss, Steve Piscopo - participated in three weekends over September and October 2007 in the ACMI Animation Open Studios (as part of Pixar) sharing their secrets with people of all ages. Using a combination of moving image, stills and animation to a music soundtrack, this is a record of what took place.

results.title: Rear Window [DVD]
results.brief_description: A freelance travelling news photographer with a broken leg is confined in his Greenwich Village apartment during a New York heatwave. A voyeuristic impulse leads him from curiosity to suspicion of murder as he observes his neighbours in the apartments opposite.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

constellations_other.name: Suburban scenes (Lisa McCune)
constellations_other.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

results.description: A freelance travelling news photographer with a broken leg is confined in his Greenwich Village apartment during a New York heatwave. A voyeuristic impulse leads him from curiosity to suspicion of murder as he observes his neighbours in the apartments opposite. His morbid curiosity is marked by a switch from binoculars to a telephoto lens as he watches a ‘silent’ film of other people’s lives. To Hitchcock it was the visual construction of a mental process, ‘the epitome of the subjective treatment’. Cast includes James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Wendell Corey, Thelma Ritter. Screenplay by John Michael Hayes based on a the short story by Cornell Woolrich. Photography by Robert Burks. Music by Franz Waxman.
description_for_label: A freelance travelling news photographer with a broken leg is confined in his Greenwich Village apartment during a New York heatwave. A voyeuristic impulse leads him from curiosity to suspicion of murder as he observes his neighbours in the apartments opposite. His morbid curiosity is marked by a switch from binoculars to a telephoto lens as he watches a ‘silent’ film of other people’s lives. To Hitchcock it was the visual construction of a mental process, ‘the epitome of the subjective treatment’. Cast includes James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Wendell Corey, Thelma Ritter. Screenplay by John Michael Hayes based on a the short story by Cornell Woolrich. Photography by Robert Burks. Music by Franz Waxman.

results.title: Body Melt
results.creator_credit: 1 for Dumb Films, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, Rod Bishop, Daniel Scharf and Philip Brophy
results.brief_description: Something weird is happening in suburban Pebbles Court, Homesville. The residents are unknowingly part of a diabolical experiment with a radical ‘90’s body drug.

constellations_other.name: Suburban scenes (Lisa McCune)
constellations_other.description: Lisa McCune is best known for her role as Constable Maggie Doyle in the television series Blue Heelers (1994–2006). In addition to showing the day-to-day lives of police in a small Victorian town, the series explores the various dynamics of suburbia—a theme present throughout the whole of screen media.

results.creator_credit_for_label: 1 for Dumb Films, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria, Rod Bishop, Daniel Scharf and Philip Brophy
results.description: Something weird is happening in suburban Pebbles Court, Homesville. The residents are unknowingly part of a diabolical experiment with a radical ‘90’s body drug. Some will survive but most will not! The first phase is hallucinogenic, the second phase is glandular and the third phase is Body Melt! “An inventive and laudably tasteless journey into the surreal” Sight & Sound (UK). “Packs more mucous, phlegm, puke, snot, slime and spit than you ever thought possible” Starburst (UK). If you enjoyed “Salt, saliva, sweat and sperm” in the ‘80’s by the same producers and director, then this is the ‘90’S experience you have been craving! Based on four short stories by Philip Brophy. Starring Gerard Kennedy, Ian Smith, Andrew Daddo, Lisa McCune, Brett Climo, Vince Gil and William McInnes.
description_for_label: Something weird is happening in suburban Pebbles Court, Homesville. The residents are unknowingly part of a diabolical experiment with a radical ‘90’s body drug. Some will survive but most will not! The first phase is hallucinogenic, the second phase is glandular and the third phase is Body Melt! “An inventive and laudably tasteless journey into the surreal” Sight & Sound (UK). “Packs more mucous, phlegm, puke, snot, slime and spit than you ever thought possible” Starburst (UK). If you enjoyed “Salt, saliva, sweat and sperm” in the ‘80’s by the same producers and director, then this is the ‘90’S experience you have been craving! Based on four short stories by Philip Brophy. Starring Gerard Kennedy, Ian Smith, Andrew Daddo, Lisa McCune, Brett Climo, Vince Gil and William McInnes.

results.title: Polo
results.brief_description:
Do nightmares come true? In a tale of a dark strange land, a silent outcast and a powerful robot, a creator will try to harness his creation.
Music by James Hodsons.
